subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






April 30, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESPet Food Toxin Said To Be Common In China
The toxic chemical melamine is commonly added to animal feed in China, a manager of a feed company said, a process that boosts
                        the feed's sales value. The U.S. recall of 100 brands of pet food has been tied to wheat gluten contaminated by melamine. More...
• George Tenet: At The Center Of The Storm
                     					| Watch• 5 U.S. Troops Killed In Iraq, 104 In April
                     					| Watch• 4 Dead In Kansas City Shooting SpreeU.S.4 Dead In Kansas City Shooting Spree
A man driving a dead woman's car shot a police officer, then opened fire in a parking lot and a mall Sunday, authorities said.
                        By the end of the day, four people, including the gunman, were dead. More...
• Pet Food Toxin Said To Be Common In China• Armed And Dangerous
                     					| Watch• Tanker Fire Causes Ca. Highway Collapse
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorld5 U.S. Troops Killed In Iraq, 104 In April
The military says five more American troops were killed in Iraq during the weekend, pushing the U.S. death toll for April
                        to 104. Meanwhile, daily violence continues to claim Iraqi lives, including two new bomb attacks in Baghdad. More...Watch: Iraq: Another New Way Forward?
• U.K. Finds 5 Guilty Of Bomb Plot• New NATO Afghan Offensive Targets Taliban• Pet Food Toxin Said To Be Common In China• More StoriesPoliticsRice: Bush Will Not Give In On Iraq Bill
President George W. Bush will not support a war spending bill that punishes the Iraqi government for failing to meet benchmarks
                        for progress, Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice said on Face The Nation. More...Watch: Rice On Iraq, Tenet
• Protests Greet Gonzales At Harvard Reunion• Rice Dismisses Tenet's Accusations
                     					| Watch• Wolfowitz Faces Ethics Panel At World Bank• More StoriesHealthDrink Away Your Weight?
There's a new category of soft drinks which promise to burn calories. Are they too good to be true? Nutritionist Samantha
                        Heller of Health magazine has the low-down of these cutting edge diet drinks.  More...Watch: Mistaking Hunger For Thirst
• Despite Drug War, Cocaine Purer, Cheaper• Depression Before Parkinson's Disease?• As Boomers Age, Arthritis Costs Rise• More StoriesSciTechE-Mail Etiquette: The Do's and Don'ts
The "e" in e-mail might as well stand for "essential": Most of us have become hopelessly dependent on communicating with e-mail.
                        But as Daniel Sieberg notes, many of us can use tips on how to use this technology for good, not evil.  More...
• Blasting Some Owls To Save Others?• The Great Midwestern Gold Rush
                     					| Watch• HD TV's Spark Rabbit Ear Revival• More StoriesBusinessGerman Supermarkets Become Senior-Friendly
Germany's Kaiser grocery chain has transformed their supermarkets to "senior markets" with such improvements as step stools,
                        magnifying lenses and "relaxation zones" to appeal to the country's fastest-growing demographic. More...Watch: Senior-Friendly Grocery Stores
• Dow Reaches Record High
                     					| Watch• HD TV's Spark Rabbit Ear Revival• U.S. Economic Growth Slows To Near Crawl• More StoriesEntertainment"Disturbia" Is 3 Week Box Office Champ
Movie-goers have put the thriller "Disturbia" at the top of the box office list for the third weekend in a row, but total
                        ticket sales continue to slump ahead of an anticipated theater rush for the release of "Spider-Man 3". More...
• Cops: Ex-Idol Finalist Busted For Drugs• Oh, What Webs Today's Superheroes Weave!• Scotty's Final Trip To The Final Frontier
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionRocca On The Boards
Sunday Morning commentator Mo Rocca was always very serious about his fun, like his passion for appearing on
                        stage. Now he's appearing on Broadway, and for all that work he is having a ball.  More...
• Andy: Thanks For Writing• Schieffer: On Losing A Good Man
                     					| Watch• Corruption Comes Back To Haunt GOP
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Susan Koeppen: Proper Tire Pressure: Possible Lifesaver
Susan Koeppen warns that under-inflated tires are a real risk: They can cause drivers to lose control and get into
                        accidents. She explains, on The Early Show. More...
• 60 Minutes: George Tenet: At The Center Of The Storm

Departure Of An ElephantDue to pressure from animal rights groups who believe elephants suffer in cramped enclosures at zoo's, this elephant is heading
                                    into retirement. Dulary isn't alone though. Anthony Mason has more.
